property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: School is one of the most important locations in Hometown. [[Kris]]'s classmates are introduced, and it contains the [[Closet Dark World]] and [[Card Kingdom]], with the former being a recurring location in later [[Chapter]]s.

property.name: description
property.value: Dreemurr Residence is the home of [[Kris]], [[Toriel]], [[Asriel]] and formerly [[Asgore]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dreemurr Residence

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] can have her recall her memories of their childhood, or offer the [[Bouquet]] to her if they visited the [[Flower King]]. This interaction transfers to [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. Kris does not do this option by default.

property.name: description
property.value: Catty appears in front of her house in [[Chapter 1]] and talks to [[Kris]] about her sister, [[Catti]], [[Asriel]], and [[Bratty]].

property.name: description
property.value: Dad Cat appears in front of his family house in [[Chapter 1]]. He talks about how [[Asriel]], who he named "Doug," did not like his wife's cooking, and that [[Kris]], who he names "Douglas," does not like frozen cat food. Interacting again causes him to hope that Asriel remembers his neighbors.

property.name: page
property.value: Dad Cat

property.name: description
property.value: These two are enjoying the scenery. The rabbit Royal Guard is enthusiastic, while the dragon Royal Guard agrees with a laconic temperament.

property.name: page
property.value: Royal Guards

property.name: description
property.value: He appears at the opposite staircase of [[Kris]]. When interacted with, Asgore ackowledges the seven flowers are difficult to tend to due to the climate. Asgore also comments if Kris inspects the air matress and refrigerator.

property.name: page
property.value: Asgore Dreemurr

property.name: description
property.value: He suggests to [[Kris]] that when [[Asriel]] returns, they can all go to [[QC's Diner]]. He thinks of possibly driving them around town.

property.name: page
property.value: Asgore Dreemurr

property.name: description
property.value: This NPC, whose verbal quirks are similar to those of ''[[ut:Undertale]]''<nowiki />'s [[ut:Mettaton|Mettaton]], doe not let [[Kris]] into their house. Second interaction causes them to be surprised that Kris wants to talk to them, though they describe themselves as a "nobody."

property.name: description
property.value: Bratty can express disdain for [[Catty]], remember playing truth or dare with [[Asriel]], or recall when [[Kris]] wanted to be friends with her.

property.name: description
property.value: Alphys can explain where the flowers are from, that the milk saucer is for [[MewMew]], or forgives [Kris]] for not getting the chalk. She encourages Kris to visit any time.

property.name: description
property.value: Snowy is jealous of [[Kris]] for skipping [[Alphys]]'s class for today, and comments that [[Snowy's Father|his dad]] would scold him.

property.name: description
property.value: He assumes [[Snowy]] is knocking hard on the door, and tells Snowy to stop as it would hurt.

property.name: page
property.value: Snowy's Father

property.name: description
property.value: Monster Kid is glad to see [[Kris]] has survived [[Susie]]. He recalls playing handball with [[Snowy]] and [[Jockington]], and Susie had watched them play, and also caused [[Undyne]] to trounce them in handball. Interacting again causes Monster Kid to notice Kris looks annoyed.

property.name: page
property.value: Monster Kid

property.name: description
property.value: Acknowledges that [[Kris]] has beginner knocking skills, and asks them to come back later when they have improved.

property.name: description
property.value: If [[Kris]] knocks on this door, the child asks Kris if it hurts to be made out of blood.

property.name: page
property.value: Innkeeper's Child

property.name: description
property.value: Pizzapants takes off his [[ICE-E]]'s mascot costume to greet [[Kris]] amicably. He expresses disdain at his co-workers and his job at [[Hometown#ICE-E's P"e"zza|ICE-E's P"e"zza]], and how he aspires to go to the same college as [[Asriel]]. If Kris decides not to converse, Pizzapants understands, and tells them to enjoy "freedom" while they still can.

property.name: description
property.value: Advertises some of the "24 Pezza Flavors." If [[Kris]] interacts again, Blue Ears admits he mistook the [[ICE-E's P"e"zza]] for an ice cream shop, but enjoys the job and his co-workers.

property.name: page
property.value: Blue Ears

property.name: description
property.value: He is enthusiastic about his job.

property.name: page
property.value: Purple Guy

property.name: description
property.value: Compliments their look, but immediately admits to putting leftover pancakes in their hat. Interacting again causes them to admit to loving pancakes.

property.name: page
property.value: Hat Monster

property.name: description
property.value: He asks for edible glitter, as his youngest child only consumes food that looks like treasure. The second time causes Dad Dragon to admits sprinkles is also acceptable.

property.name: page
property.value: Dad Dragon

property.name: description
property.value: She is glad to see that [[Kris]] survived [[Susie]], then admits she is working. Interacting again causes her to admit the uniform is mandatory for [[QC's Diner]].

property.name: description
property.value: Admits to preferring ice as the drink. Interacting with Ice Wolf again causes them to admit to liking [[ICE-E|ice-themed mascots]].

property.name: page
property.value: Ice Wolf

property.name: description
property.value: This monster, resembling the [[ut:Skateboard Girl|Skateboard Girl]] from ''[[ut:Undertale|Undertale]]'', reminisces about skipping the first hour of [[Gerson]]'s class to eat crepes at the diner. This almost made her fail her year, but she attributes passing to her bringing the leftovers to Gerson.

property.name: page
property.value: Tentacled Monster

property.name: description
property.value: This NPC, resembling ''[[ut:Undertale|Undertale]]''<nowiki />'s [[ut:Fuku Fire|Fuku Fire]], likes the vibe of QC's. She considers signing up for waitstaff, worries that she would melt all ice in drinks if she gets nervous.

property.name: page
property.value: Fire Elemental

property.name: description
property.value: Is taking the orders for [[Fire Elemental]] and [[Tentacled Monster]]. Interacting again causes Waitress Lion to ask how the firewood will be done.

property.name: page
property.value: Waitress Lion

property.name: description
property.value: Father Alvin stands in front of the [[Church]]. He is surprised to see [[Kris]] visiting on a [[School]] day. If Kris mentions "Fruit Juice," Father Alvin suggests that Kris partakes in service, and possibly sing in the choir like [[Asriel|their brother]] used to.

property.name: page
property.value: Father Alvin

property.name: description
property.value: Explains the [[Mayor]]'s diligence, though admits she lacks charisma. Interacting again causes Politics Bear to state that she sets the AC to be extremely cold.

property.name: page
property.value: Politics Bear

property.name: description
property.value: Apologizes to [[Kris]] and states that the [[Mayor]] is busy. Interacting again causes Hand Receptionist to apologize and comment on [[Alphys]] getting hired for [[School]] thanks to [[Toriel]].

property.name: page
property.value: Hand Receptionist

property.name: description
property.value: He calls [[Kris]] "short-stuff" and questions them for wanting to visit the [[Mayor]], then suggests that they go to the police instead. Interacting again implies Kris does not want to be called a "kid," and Briefcase Dude still recommends they go to the police.

property.name: page
property.value: Briefcase Dude

property.name: description
property.value: Napstablook has become a police officer by accident, but cannot quit due to their cousins relying on them. In [[Chapter 1]], if [[Kris]] knocks on the Police Station's door, Napstablook simply closes the blinds.

property.name: description
property.value: He greets [[Kris]] and asks if [[Toriel]] made them visit. Either option prompts a different reaction from him. Kris can converse with Rudy about [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]], his illness, and reminisces about some memories he had of [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]], [[Toriel]], and Kris's mischief. He also comments on the objects Kris inspects.

property.name: page
property.value: Rudolph Holiday

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that the hospital employees brought him here. However, he wants to "BATTLE!!!"

property.name: page
property.value: The Warrior

property.name: description
property.value: Asks [[Kris]] if they are visiting to play the piano, and that they enjoy it. Interacting again causes Red Big Mouth to mention [[Undyne]] occasionally playing as well. If Kris has played the hospital piano, Red Big Mouth ackowledges their piano playing is off, and that Kris appears to look a little sick.

property.name: name
property.value: Red Big Mouth

property.name: description
property.value: Scared Donut Guy laments that he is unable to get around [[Undyne]]. He considers that perhaps running away may be the ideal option.

property.name: page
property.value: Scared Donut Guy

property.name: description
property.value: In [[Chapter 1]]'s epilogue, Undyne is on the street, and directing traffic by yelling at everyone to get out of her way. However, she pauses to talk with "[[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]]'s kid." She appears to not recognize [[Alphys]]'s name. Kris can also try to inform her of the [[Dark World]] in [[School]], though Undyne claims that is a job for the school board.

property.name: description
property.value: Snail Guy explains to [[Kris]] what [[Undyne]] has been doing to direct traffic. He claims to feel directed by her method.

property.name: page
property.value: Snail Guy

property.name: description
property.value: Striped Bird expresses excitement for the books upstairs, and recommends that [[Kris]] should read them. However, Striped Bird blocks the staircase to the second floor. The second floor becomes partially accesible in [[Chapter 2]].

property.name: page
property.value: Striped Bird

property.name: description
property.value: She insists on wanting to study hard for college. However, Temmie reads comic books on "hot demon guys" instead.

property.name: description
property.value: He happily greets [[Kris]] and explains that [[Catti]] is at work, and that he is working on their project in advance. His papers have a soccer ball drawn 73 times. Interacting again causes him to make a related pun.

property.name: description
property.value: Berdly works as a volunteer assistant at [[library]]'s desk. He is surprised that [[Kris]] has survived [[Susie]], and mocks Kris for not returning ''How to Draw Dragons'' for 2583 days. Interacting with Berdly again causes him to describe the book's cover. If Kris overheard [[Rudolph Holiday|rudy]] and [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]], they suggest that Berdly should go to the [[Hospital]] window.

property.name: description
property.value: Reminds [[Kris]] that he is always partners with [[Catti]] ever since gym class. He also claims he and Catti are similar as they can both unhinge jaws and breathe.

property.name: description
property.value: Is texting on her phone. She states she is taken.

property.name: description
property.value: Suggests that [[Kris]] should come to [[School]] sooner next time, and they state they would rather be partnerless than be with [[Snowy]]

property.name: page
property.value: Monster Kid

property.name: description
property.value: Turns his head towards [[Kris]] and states he is partners with [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]], who he considers the "2nd smartest student." Berdly also mocks Kris, and would rather get an "A" on the project.

property.name: description
property.value: She apologizes to [[Kris]] and brings out her partner, EG.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] asks what she is watching on her phone, which is implied to Mew Mew anime. Alphys changes the topic by asking if Kris found a partner. After [[Susie]] appears, she tells Kris to go outside.

properties.property: (Here at ICE-E'S PEZZA, You're Family.) (... Is Going to Love it!)
(The entrance is locked.) (No one's inside.) (Seems like all of the employees are outside in costume.)

property.name: description
property.value: (Ice E's P"E"ZZA, You're number "1" Spot for a piping hot pe"E"ce of PEZZA.)

properties.property: (Police tape is blocking the way.) (The tape simply reads "NGAHHHHH!!!")
(It's a classic 1-to-10 pain scale, using [[ICE-E]] as a model.) (At 0 pain, he's happy.) (At 10 pain, he's happy and sweating.)

property.name: description
property.value: (It's a diagram showing a bunch of lines and a circle.)

property.name: description
property.value: [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] gave [[Rudolph Holiday|Rudy]] these roses. However, Rudy jokes about it being nonsensical.

property.name: description
property.value: A card bought by [[Toriel]], with the inside signed by [[Kris]]. When inspected, [[Rudolph Holiday|Rudy]] jokingly questions why Kris is looking at their own penmanship as if they have never seen it before.

property.name: description
property.value: This card displays [[Rudolph Holiday|Rudy]]'s full name. If [[Kris]] inspects this, Rudy jokes that they do not remember their name. Inspecting it again causes him to joke that they are jealous.

properties.property: (It's one of those sliding bead toys that naturally spawns inside doctors' offices.) (The beads march grimly along their set path.)

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] can choose to play this piano. If played, [[Red Big Mouth]] comments on this. Choosing not to causes their hands linger on the keys.

properties.property: ([[Gerson Boom]] Memorial Bench)\n "Throughout my career, some of my best ideas came from dreams."\n "Take a rest here. If anyone asks -- you're writing!"
[[Gerson Boom|GERSON]] RENOWNED HISTORIAN, AUTHOR, AND TEACHER
[[CRYSTAL]] A SNOWY GEMSTONE FOR A PROUD MOTHER
[[MUTTLER]] A BIG BONE FOR THE LEADER OF THE PACK
[[SHYRA]] A KARAOKE MICROPHONE FOR A BRAVE SINGER
"Lord of the Hammer" (First in the award-winning fiction series by lauded historian [[Gerson Boom]].)
"Please remember my name. Please. I wrote a book to help you remember." (By [[Hots Fireguy]])

(It's an unlabelled book. You look inside...) oh.... i accidentally returned my personal journal instead of my book... oh no.... they're putting it into their catalogue... oh no... i have to take it out every time i want to write a new entry...

(You looked through the window to the computer lab...) (There seems to be [[Annoying Dog|a dog]] inside working at a computer...) (Seems like it's making a game...) (Seems like you shouldn't interrupt it...) (Seems like when the game's finished, you can go in...) (You just have to trust the dog...) '''After interacting:''' (You looked through the window to the computer lab...) (Now the dog is just playing the maracas...) (It's not doing any work...) (This might take a while...)

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] can choose to read "[[Alphys|The Anonymous Yellow Lizard]]'s review of Mew Mew Kissy Cutie 2, where she also expresses her disdain for the prequel and Mew Mew's characterization in it.

properties.property: (There's a crude drawing of an [[ICE-E|ice-cube]] wearing a headband.) ("The TeenZone: Where Teen's Can Be Kid's.") (A feeling of immense relief washes over you.)

property.name: description
property.value: (The Throne of the Gods.)

properties.property: (Some kind of primitive sculpture.) (Who knows what it represents?)

property.name: description
property.value: (It's a primitive drawing of [[Toriel|your mom]].)

properties.property: (Kids' books.) (Some of them used to be [[Kris|yours]].)
(It's a poster of several basic shapes.) (Circle, Oval, Square...) (Hyperdodecahedron...)

property.name: description
property.value: (Some kind of teacher food.)

properties.property: (It's a computer.) (Its desktop wallpaper is [[Kris|you]] and [[Asriel|your brother]] dressed up for Halloween 8 years ago.)
("Ms. [[Toriel]]" is written in cursive on the dry-erase board.) (Seems like it hasn't been erased in a very long time.)
(It's [[Kris|your]] locker.) (It's empty.)

property.name: description
property.value: (This used to be [[Asriel|your brother]]'s locker.)

properties.property: Do you like, breathing? Moving fast, with or without, legs? But usually, with legs? Join the Cross Country Team with [[Jockington]], and [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]]!

property.name: description
property.value: The door is locked.

properties.property: (It's a yellowed, poorly-drawn picture of a [[Gerson Boom|green turtle]].) (It's signed '[[Father Alvin|Alvin]].')

property.name: description
property.value: (Playing cards spill out of a deck in the closet.)

property.name: description
property.value: (It's a worn-down stuffed animal.)

properties.property: (Are you ready for the Sadie Hawkman's dance?) (At this dance, all the chaperones wear giant hawk heads...) (... and screech at any students that make contact while dancing.)

property.name: description
property.value: (The locker is covered in [[Jockington]] memorabilia.)

properties.property: (It's a black-and-white hardboiled egg.) (Sadly, seems like it already has a partner.) '''After [[Susie]] appears:''' (The hardboiled egg emanates a feeling of pity towards you.)

(The computer's wallpaper is a rotating slideshow of nature images.) (... and, rarely, an image of two buff superheroes embracing, blushing.) '''In [[Chapter 1]] epilogue:''' (The computer is turned off.) (Everything felt peaceful for a moment.)

property.name: description
property.value: It's a book of hymns.

properties.property: It's the TV. Doesn't seem to even be plugged in anymore.

property.name: description
property.value: It's a landline phone. But you already have a [[Cell Phone|cell phone]].

properties.property: It's a trashcan. Somehow, it's emitting a pleasant floral scent. '''After giving [[Toriel]] the [[Bouquet|bouquet]] from [[Asgore]]:''' Somehow, its floral scent has increased.
There's some cinnamony batter caked on the stovetop. '''After returning from the [[Closet Dark World]]:''' (It's a butterscotch-cinnamon pie.) (It's still cooling.)

property.name: description
property.value: There is some white fur stuck in the drain.

property.name: description
property.value: There's a photo on the fridge. It's of [[Kris|you]], [[Toriel|your mother]], and [[Asriel|your brother]].

properties.property: On the shower ledge, there's a small container of apple-scented shampoo. ... and a gallon-sized container of pet shampoo. '''Chapter 2, during bathroom cutscene:''' (No need for it.) '''Chapter 2, after bathroom cutscene:''' (The apple-scented shampoo feels lighter than usual.)

property.name: description
property.value: Interacting with this toilet several times leads to additional flavor text.

properties.property: You looked inside the sink cupboard. There's... A can of [[ICE-E|Ice-E]]'s Cool Boys Body Spray "Spray For The Boys," Flamin' Hot Pizza Flavor. It seems to be almost entirely full.

'''Chapter 1:''' There are many books. Tales of Snails - A Story Book. Snails Do Not Have Tails - A Scientific Refutation. Can Snails Help Your Garden? Um, Not Really. And a signed copy of The History of Humans and Monsters, by [[Gerson Boom]]. '''After interacting:''' There's no time to read anything right now.

property.name: description
property.value: The door is locked.

property.name: description
property.value: It's only you.

properties.property: '''Chapter 1:''' There are crayons in the drawer. Their labels have long faded, and there's no green.
A cactus. There's not much to say about it.
It's a computer desk. There are many boxes under it filled with old books.
'''[[Chapter 1]]:''' There are CDs under the bed. Classical, jazz, religious ska... There's also a game console. It has one normal controller, and one knock-off one.

'''[[Chapter 1]]:''' The drawer is mostly empty, except for... '''[[SAVE|Save]] slot 1:''' A school cross country shirt with a tear in it. '''Save slot 2:''' A very old school ID with an embarrassing haircut. '''Save slot 3:''' A coupon book. Every coupon is for half-off a large pizza. All the coupons expired before the book's print date. '''After interacting:''' There's nothing useful in the drawer.
It's a red wagon with a rusty birdcage in it. Looks like it's seen quite a few crashes.

property.name: description
property.value: If [[Kris]] enters [[Flower King]], [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] gives them a [[Bouquet]] meant for [[Toriel]] when they exit the shop. Giving it to Toriel can transfer to [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. This is not an option Kris does by default.

property.name: description
property.value: QC gives [[Kris]] a cup of [[Hot Chocolate]] for free after reminiscing about Kris's family visiting after [[Church]] service. This interaction transfers to [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. Kris does not do this option by default.

property.name: page
property.value: QC (Diner Shopkeeper)

property.name: description
property.value: When [[Kris]] and [[Susie]] first enter the [[School]]'s Supply Closet, the [[Closet Dark World]] becomes the primary [[Dark World]] setting in [[Chapter 1]].

property.name: page
property.value: Closet Dark World

property.name: description
property.value: During the [[Chapter 1]] ending cutscene, [[Kris]] rips their [[SOUL]] out in this location, throws it in the cage, and pulls out a knife. The SOUL can be moved slightly while it is in the cage.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] welcomes [[Kris]], and informs them that the pie will cool down when they wake up, and insists that they do not eat it all.

property.name: description
property.value: When [[Kris]] interacts Noelle, they can mention [[Susie]]. This causes Noelle to give Susie a [[Light Candy|lunchbox of chalk]] in [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. Kris does not do this option by default.

property.name: page
property.value: Noelle Holiday

property.name: description
property.value: In [[Chapter 1]]'s epilogue, [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]] can be found waiting here after [[Kris]] visits [[Rudolph Holiday]] in the [[hospital]].

property.name: description
property.value: Onion appears if [[Kris]] idles long enough at the edge. They ask Kris if they can be friends. Choosing to be friends or being impolite to Onion transfers to [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. Kris does not do this option by default.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] can inspect [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] and [[Toriel]]'s wedding photo. If Kris opens the fridge and found an [[Egg]] in the [[Closet Dark World]], they put in without a prompt. Opening the fridge reveals that the Egg became two Eggs.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] is glad to see [[Kris]] is fine. She tells them to not worry about skipping class, and that they are not in trouble. Alphys encourages Kris to talk with her. This interaction transfers to [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. This is also the only option Kris does by default in the epilogue.

property.name: description
property.value: He greets [[Kris]] and introduces himself. This interaction causes Sans to ask Kris to spend time with his younger brother, which transfers to [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. Kris does not do this option by default. If Kris asks to be friends with Sans, he offers a [[Cell Phone]] number that Kris can call in Chapter 1.

property.name: description
property.value: An angel doll with no face. It was made by [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]] and [[Dess Holiday|Dess]] in their youth group. [[Rudolph Holiday|Rudy]] keeps it as a good luck charm, and reminisces when Kris and [[Asriel]] tried to make one as well.

property.name: description
property.value: If [[Kris]] inspects this sink before or after interacting with [[Rudolph Holiday|Rudy]], Rudy acknowledges this and makes a joke out of it. This inspection carries over into [[Chapter 2]] via [[Chapter 1]]'s [[SAVE]] Completion file. Kris does not do this option by default.

property.name: description
property.value: Upon entering, [[Kris]] overhears [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]] and [[Rudolph Holiday|Rudy]]'s conversation about her mother, Dragon Blazers III, and [[Berdly]]. As Noelle exits, she is surprised to see Kris visiting.

property.name: description
property.value: Near this bunker, the sound mus_smile can be heard. This sound is associated with ''[[ut:Undertale|Undertale]]'''s [[W.D. Gaster]].

object.name: Cell Phone call at School door

property.name: description
property.value: In the [[Chapter 1]] epilogue, if [[Kris]] does not use their [[Cell Phone]] to call [[Toriel]], this call is scripted to occur near the [[School]]'s front door. Toriel expresses her worry, and Kris informs that they spent time with "a friend." Pleased, Toriel relents, but then states that Kris must sleep early when they return to the [[Dreemurr Residence]].

property.name: description
property.value: When [[Kris]] exits the [[School]]'s Unused Classroom, [[Susie]] notices the sun has already set. The two go the front of the Supply Closet, and Susie suggests to Kris that they both should return to the [[Closet Dark World]] tomorrow. [[Chapter 1]]'s epilogue begins.

property.name: description
property.value: After [[Kris]] and [[Susie]]'s adventure in [[Card Kingdom]], they return to [[Light World]] and appear in the [[School]]'s Unused Classroom. It appears to contain real world representations of [[Darkners]] from that [[Dark World]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Susie]] tells [[Kris]] that the Supply Closet is "broken," and reasons that [[Alphys]] can get the chalk herself. The two try to leave the Supply Closet, only for the door to abruptly close. Suddenly, the papers below them fall, and they descent into [[??????]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Susie]] is confused that the Supply Closet is unusually large and continues further.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Susie]] is confused she cannot find the switch and goes further inside.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Susie]] notices ths old papers on the floor. She tries to progress further to find the lightswitch. If [[Kris]] tries to exit, Susie calls out to them, which makes them stop.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Susie]] acknowledges that the Supply Closet is unusually dark, and is discomforted. She insists [[Kris]] should go first, only to notice they step away. She reasons that she and [[Kris]] should enter the Supply Closet at the same time.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Susie]] waits for [[Kris]] at the [[School]]'s entrance hall. If Kris chooses to progress, she comments if Kris walks or outpaces her. If Kris explores, she mocks and informs them that they are going the wrong direction, or comments on them using the water fountain.

property.name: description
property.value: When [[Kris]] exits [[Alphys]]'s Classroom, they find [[Susie]] eating chalk. Susie notices Kris, and menaces them by pushing them onto the lockers. However, she considers [[Toriel]], and states that Kris will do the entire project. Kris can then partially explore the [[School]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] can have [[Noelle Holiday|Noelle]] ask [[Alphys]] to let them be partners with her and [[Berdly]], to which he disagrees. [[Susie]] arrives shortly after, and Alphys assigns Kris and Susie as partners. After partially listening to Noelle, Alphys asks Kris and Susie to get chalk from the Supply Closet. Afterwards, Noelle reassures Kris if they interact with her. Kris can also interact with the other students twice for their opinions.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] ackowledges [[Kris]]'s tardiness, and states they must find a partner for the group project. Kris can then interact with the other students.

property.name: description
property.value: At the start of [[Chapter 1]], exiting the house causes the driving cutscene to begin. [[Toriel]] reminises about [[Asriel]] and drives [[Kris]] to [[School]]. Along the way, various [[Hometown]] residents greet them.

property.name: description
property.value: In the [[Chapter 1]] epilogue, [[Kris]] can end the [[Chapter]] by going to sleep. After completing the Chapter, interacting with this bed allows Kris to immediately enter the [[Dark World]] and [[??????]]. This skips the introduction cutscenes and [[School]] sequence.
